ComicInfo.Title: Walt Disney Donald Duck: Scandal on the Epoch Express
ComicInfo.Summary:
Dieu Dieu Duck: Donald wrecks the nephews' robot lawn mower and the wreckage is declared a work of art by an art critic.
Family Feud: Zeke's brother Zeb tries to show Zeke how to overcome the pigs' defenses.
Daisy Duck's Diatribe!: Donald asks Daisy to housesit while he and the boys go on a fishing vacation, warning her against the unneighborly actions of Neighbor Jones. At the same time, Neighbor Jones also goes on a fishing vacation, leaving his cousin Josie Jones to housesit. The crude, uncouth Josie Jones proves to be a worse neighbor than Mr. Jones, driving Daisy to distraction. While Daisy tries valiantly to maintain her composure in the face of such destructive obnoxiousness, she ultimately succumbs with gusto making the Daisy/Josie feud more intense than the Donald/Jones affair.
Over Easy: Donald builds a chicken coop in the yard and tries to encourage the hens to lay eggs.
The Laurels of Julius Pecunius: Scrooge takes over an Italian villa for non-payment and discovers some rare artifacts belonging to a Roman emperor stricken from the history books.
Bargain Battle!: A scheming Daisy uses Donald's position as a security guard with Duckingdales Department Store as a means to gain an unfair advantage at a coming sale.
Forty-Wink Zeke: Zeke is sleeping through the day because he's sleepwalking at night, but suspicious Practical Pig has a handy cure ready and waiting.
Regulationary War: Donald and Neighbor Jones' boundary regulation war goes too far.
Trapdoor Trick: The nephews sell rides on Scrooge's office trapdoor, billing it as a "super slide".
The Daisy Chain: Donald and Gladstone's competition to win Daisy's hand gets them all handcuffed together.
Healers of the Andes: Scrooge searches the Andes for a cure to the fake medicine he took.
Nothin' Beats the Classics: Huey, Dewey, and Louie are embarrassed to be seen in their uncle's old car, which is constantly breaking down, but Donald stubbornly resists all efforts to have him to buy a new one. Does Gyro Gearloose have a solution to revitalize Old Number 313, why is the car suddenly acting as if it had a mind of its own, and how does this spirited sports coupe manage to save Donald and the boys from kidnappers seeking a ransom from Uncle Scrooge?
Don Quiduck de la Mancha: Donald rehearses for a part opposite Daisy in "Man of La Mancha" so intensely that he hypnotizes himself into thinking he really is Don Quixote (here called "Don Quiduck"). In his delirium, Donald rides off with the only copy of the combination to Uncle Scrooge's new vault door attached to his lance, with Uncle Scrooge and the boys in hot pursuit. The Beagle Boys observe the situation and make their play for the coveted slip of paper.
Winifred's Revenge Part 1 of 2: Scrooge runs afoul of a witch during Christmas season and everybody in Duckburg must suffer for it.
Scent-imental Romeos: Donald and Gladstone race around town to find a scent for themselves that Daisy will like.
Big Brain Blowout: Out to win a knowledge-bet with the kids, Donald is accidently turned into an off-the-charts genius by a wacky scientist's malfunctioning brain probe. He soon becomes a god to an auditorium-full of oddball academic types.
Scandal on the Epoch Express: Donald and the boys are working as stewards on the refurbished Epoch Express luxury train. Also aboard are a Brutopian spy and the police inspector looking to catch him.
Winifred's Revenge Part 2 of 2: Scrooge runs afoul of a witch during Christmas season and everybody in Duckburg must suffer for it.
